Entries.default:
"It is good to see you well, Watcher. I believe the boars were hoping for easy meat."

Chitupec greets you with a relieved nod, and checks the pistol at his hip.

"Watcher? Is that you?" 

The ghostly figure turns towards you, voice rising eagerly.
"So why are you out here?"

"I was able to calm one of the boars with a spell. For a time, at least.

"By the time I was through, I had lost sight of Beodul."
"What happened?"

"I came over this way in hopes of gathering some of that blood moss over there. I thought it might be of use.

"I imagine the boars had the same idea."
"The boatswain, Beodul, is in that cave over there. Ran in after a boar. Stubborn old dwarf."

"After we made landfall, you mean? I woke and Beodul was close by, swearing fit to bring Ondra's wrath upon us a second time.

"We began to search for supplies."
"Get back to the beach. We'll meet there."
"I'll look for Beodul."
"I am glad for the chance to thank you for saving my life back on the ship. I remain in your debt, captain."

"I will make for the campfire. I must get this pistol cleaned if it is going to be of any use.

"Be careful in there, captain."
"Sounds fine to me. See you there, captain."

"Beodul came through here a short while ago. Thank you for giving him a hand, captain. 

"I thought I would see to it that you were in one piece before I followed him. See you at the campfire?"
"I suppose we are lucky to have found land."
"Beodul didn't make it."

"You were in that cave a time. Did you happen to see Beodul? He ran in after one of the boars. 

"Stubborn old dwarf."
[Lie] "I didn't see him."

"Damn. I should have... I thought he could handle himself. The boatswain was never one to ask for help."

Chitupec breathes out a sigh, shaking his head.
"Mind the boars, Watcher! I can't hold them back!"
"Watcher! Over here!"
"I remained here, hoping he would return quickly. He has not."
"They warned me strange things would come of following you, Watcher."

"Truly? I do not know where else he could have gone. He must be deeper inside the cave.

"I should not have let him go alone."

"I will see to a campfire. Perhaps someone will see the smoke and come to lend us aid.

"Take care within that cave, captain."
"Come, captain. There is little to be gained in lingering here. I will help you gather supplies."

"I came over this way in hopes of gathering some of that blood moss over there. I thought it might be of use.

"I imagine the boars had the same idea."
"Have you seen any of the others?"
"I thought I saw someone moving around on the far side of the beach. Of course, I was a little distracted at the time."

"It is strange, I see... nothing. A grey nothing. 

"What happened? I remember the ship, listing under our feet. Something struck me."
"I'm sorry. I couldn't save you."
"You're dead, spirit. Leave me alone."
"You were killed by a crate. Not the noblest end, but at least it was quick, right?"
"Who are you, spirit?"

"I am Chitupec. I was one of your crew. Do you not know me? 

"We sailed from Dyrwood to restore you. I fear I cannot help you any longer."

"I thought the end would be different. 

"You are a Watcher. You would have been our captain. Tell me, where am I to go?"
"Was it? I forget..."
"You're welcome to stick around until you figure that out."
"Don't know. But if you see the Pallid Knight, say 'hello' for me."
[Shrug.]
"What use is a dead deckhand? Go away."
"Thank you, Watcher. I will stay with you a time. Until my path is clear."

Chitupec's ghostly brow wrinkles with mournful confusion.

He says nothing further, but as you move away you become aware of his presence, following in your wake.
